snippet: Jonathan Marray and Frederik Nielsen survived yet another five-set match to win the men's doubles title. Marray ended a 76-year drought for British tennis, and Nielsen was the first Danish man to reach a Wimbledon final since his grandfather.
abstract: Jonathan Marray and Frederik Nielsen survived yet another five-set match to win the men's doubles title. Marray ended a 76-year drought for British tennis, and Nielsen was the first Danish man to reach a Wimbledon final since his grandfather.

headline.main: A Rare Double in Men's Doubles
